Material used.Description: Cells were homogenized in lysis buffer for analysis of wild-type and mutated tagged-DJ-1, endogenous DJ-1, total p53 and active caspase-3.

Readout description.Result Description: D149A mutation stabilizes DJ-1 and abolishes its protective phenotype against 6OHDA-induced caspase-3 activation.
L166P mutation leads to catabolic instability and abolishes DJ-1 protective phenotype against 6OHDA-induced caspase-3 activation.

Biological replicates.Description: Bars correspond to the means ± S.E.M of 3-6 independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Experiments performed in duplicates or triplicates as indicated.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for protective phenotype.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or mock-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analyses were performed with PRISM software using the Newmann-Keuls multiple comparison tests for one-way analysis of variance or the unpaired Student's test for pair wise comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant reduction in caspase-3 activity compared to mock-transfected cells (e.g., >40% reduction).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No significant reduction in caspase-3 activity compared to mock-transfected cells (e.g., <10% reduction).

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cells were transfected and treated with 6OHDA for TUNEL analysis of cell death.

Readout description.Result Description: D149A mutation does not reduce 6OHDA-associated cell death as assessed by TUNEL-positive cells.
L166P mutation does not reduce 6OHDA-associated cell death as assessed by TUNEL-positive cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Bars correspond to the means ± SEM of 8-10 independent fields.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 transfection reduced DNA fragmentation as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty pcDNA3 vector transfection served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analyses were performed with PRISM software using the Newmann-Keuls multiple comparison tests for one-way analysis of variance or the unpaired Student's test for pair wise comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Significant reduction in TUNEL-positive cells compared to control (e.g., >50% reduction).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No significant reduction in TUNEL-positive cells compared to control (e.g., <10% reduction).

Material used.Description: Wild-type and mutated DJ-1 were transcribed and translated in vitro for cleavage by recombinant caspase-6.

Readout description.Result Description: D149A mutation fully blocks DJ-1 cleavage by caspase-6, leading to loss of protective function.
L166P mutation does not impair caspase-6 cleavage but enhances susceptibility, yet still results in loss of protective function due to instability.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 cleavage by caspase-6 served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Caspase inhibitor Ac-DEVD-CHO was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cleavage of DJ-1 by caspase-6 producing protective C-terminal fragment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: No cleavage or impaired cleavage of DJ-1 by caspase-6, resulting in loss of protective fragment.
